incidents.name: DNS Record and Wildcard Certificate Delays

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We are investigating reports of delayed wildcard SSL certificate creation and DNS record updates caused by our upstream provider. This also impacts newly created KV stores.

Existing certificates, DNS records, and KV stores are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Missing Speed Insights and Web Analytics data

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have implemented a fix, and data collection for Speed Insights and Web Analytics is working again. We are continuing to monitor.
We are continuing to investigate this issue, Web Analytics collection is also affected from 16:19 UTC
We are currently investigating an issue with the data collection of Speed Insights that started at 14:56 UTC.

Due to an upstream service disruption, we were seeing certificate issuance delays. The upstream provider has investigated the root cause of this issuance disruption and have restored services back to normal. Please see here for further details: https://letsencrypt.status.io/pages/incident/55957a99e800baa4470002da/648b36899c7c1405303ea8c4
This incident has been resolved.
We are monitoring the upstream implementation of the fix for the issue experienced earlier. At this time, serverless function creations and invocations are working as expected.

Serverless Functions are experiencing service degradation in the IAD1 (us-east-1) region due to a major outage impacting the AWS Lambda service. For more information, see the AWS status at https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status. If affected, please update your region to cle1 and redeploy (https://vercel.com/docs/concepts/functions/serverless-functions/regions).
We are currently investigating elevated error rates for serverless functions in the iad1 region.

incidents.name: Vercel DNS records loading issue for Hobby users

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are investigating an issue with the Domains UI where Vercel DNS records aren't loading for some Hobby users. We are actively investigating the issue and working towards a resolution.
This incident has been resolved.
The build queues have been processed and we are continuing to monitor.
Our team identified an issue that caused an elevation in build queue times. We have implemented a fix, and builds have begun processing.
This incident has been resolved.

The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently experiencing a delay in build logs in our cle1 (Cleveland, USA) region and are investigating the issue. We will share updates as they become available.

incidents.name: Elevated Error Rates in Serverless Functions

incident_updates.body:
A change to optimize outbound HTTP requests from Serverless Functions started gradually rolling out under a feature flag on 4/21 15:21 UTC to a subset of customers. This resulted in some serverless functions deployed after the change being unable to send the request correctly when using a third-party library that instruments serverless functions.

On 4/23 16:34 UTC, our on-call team disabled the flag to turn off the change after identifying the root cause through details provided by affected customers. After the rollback, customers were able to mitigate the issue by manually redeploying the app.

This incident only affected Serverless Functions.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating a degradation to the Deployment Status shown on the Vercel dashboard. Deployment creation will complete as normal.

incidents.name: Accidental Analytics Events Usage Email Sent

incident_updates.body: At 18:00 CEST, we were notified of customers receiving usage emails that were wrongly sent out concerning analytics events. Our team immediately turned these emails off and fixed the root cause. No real limits were hit, and no further actions are required.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We are investigating reports of delayed generation rates for SSL certificate creation caused by our upstream provider. Existing certificates generated by the Vercel platform are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

At 2023-04-11 19:30 UTC, a new version of Vercel CLI (v28.18.4) was rolled out to production. This introduced a bug that caused builds to fail for projects using Turborepo if their package dependencies define the "turbo" package with a tag name for version, such as "latest".

At 2023-04-11 22:29 UTC, a new version of Vercel CLI (v28.18.5) that fixes the bug was rolled out to production, and the incident was resolved.
This incident has been resolved.
SSL certs are being generated at a normal rate for most domains but still affect a number of isolated domains. We will share more updates as they become available.
We are currently working to publish a fix.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We are currently investigating reports of delayed generation rates for SSL certificate creation. Existing certificates generated by the Vercel platform are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.
The related GitHub incident has been resolved: https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/52z0j6phhnjs

Vercel systems are running as normal but due to a problem with GitHub, you may have trouble creating deployments and issues when using GitHub login. Other Git providers and CLI are not affected. For more information, see the GitHub status: https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/52z0j6phhnjs
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are observing degraded intake of Analytics (Audiences and Web Vitals). We are working closely with the team to resolve the issue as soon as possible.

incidents.name: Errors with Logging In Region iad1

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We've implemented fixes to mitigate the logs to log drains delay. We currently see a 5 minutes delay in receiving logs to log drains. We expect this delay to disappear in a few minutes.

We're investigating a delay in delivering Vercel Logs to Logdrains for requests to Vercel websites received in the iad1 region. We're currently seeing a delay of 15 minutes. There's no data loss. All logs will be sent.
This incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: Rate Limited Traffic of Googlebot IP Addresses

incident_updates.body:
Between Feb 13 2023 16:00 UTC and Feb 20 21:00 UTC, the Vercel Edge Network started to inadvertently rate limit traffic for up to 0.5787% of Googlebot IP addresses. This caused Google to report elevated error rates when crawling websites hosted on Vercel.

This issue has been resolved.
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
A service degradation concerning builds and deployments has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

incidents.name: Increased TLS handshake failures in arn1 region

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Users may see a TLS error (such as “ERR_SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR”) when visiting Vercel-hosted websites in the “arn1" region.

incidents.name: Elevated error rates in Serverless Functions & Static Paths in iad1 region

incident_updates.body:
At 2023-02-11 15:38 UTC, two of our cache nodes in the iad1 region experienced a catastrophic hardware failure. This resulted in increased errors in requests to Serverless Functions and static content.

At 2023-02-11 16:28-16:34 UTC, we failed the nodes over to a backup filesystem and the issue was stabilized. We later replaced the nodes entirely.

incidents.name: Elevated Error Rates in Serverless Functions

incident_updates.body:
A change to optimize outbound HTTP requests from Serverless Functions started gradually rolling out under a feature flag on 2/10 16:48 UTC to a subset of customers. This resulted in some serverless functions deployed after the change being unable to consume the response body properly.

On 2/11 13:31 UTC, our on-call team disabled the flag to turn off the change after identifying the root cause through details provided by affected customers. After the rollback, customers were able to mitigate the issue by manually redeploying the app.

This incident only affected Serverless Functions.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating reports of delays for the delivery of build logs. We will provide a further update when available.
